meanings.definition: A fused or partially fused material used in glassmaking.
meanings.sent1: The glass artist carefully added colorful frit to the molten glass.
meanings.sent2: The frit added a beautiful touch to the glass vase.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the frit for colorful pebbles and tried to collect them.
meanings.sent4: The frit sparkled like tiny jewels in the sunlight, enhancing the glass artwork.
meanings.sent5: The frit, like magical dust, transformed the plain glass into a work of art.

meanings.definition: To fuse or partially fuse (a material) in glassmaking.
meanings.sent1: The glassblower will frit the glass pieces together to create a unique design.
meanings.sent2: She carefully fritted the glass shards to form a delicate pattern.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy apprentice accidentally fritted the wrong pieces, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The heat of the furnace slowly fritted the glass into a seamless whole.
meanings.sent5: With precision and skill, she fritted the glass fragments into a stunning mosaic.
